Title: libcdio: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in libcdio.

Background.Text: libcdio is a library for accessing CD-ROM and CD images.

Description.Text: Devon Miller reported a boundary error in the "print_iso9660_recurse()" function in files cd-info.c and iso-info.c when processing long filenames within Joliet images.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted ISO image in the cd-info and iso-info applications, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Applications linking against shared libraries of libcdio are not affected.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
